As much as I am grateful for Kiva's service, I look forward to the day it will no longer be needed.
lender.occupational_info: In the US I meet with individuals about their finances and the goals they hope to reach in the future. From there we develop action plans to help them reach their fiscal destination with consistent, realistic goals based on the amount of money they make at the time of discussion.

lender.name: Bird Nest Farming.
lender.loan_because: I am a retiree and wishes to contribute to this cause when the project I intend to raise makes good returns.
lender.occupational_info:
Swiftlet Farming is a fast growing industry in this part of ASIA. The price of bird nest is good. By building farmhouse for the birds to nest is one way of preserving and help to grow the number of the birds as the traditional way of collecting the nests from it's natural cave evirament kills the young birds.
For the start to do this farming I need an estimated an amount of 30,000.00 USD to begin with. The returns will be lucrative and is expected into the first year from the start. Hence,by using this good returns it will help many other futures borrowers.

The encouragement of my woman friends was my biggest inspiration to keep trying. As women, we need to be each others champions!

lender.name: Tom and Kimmy
lender.loan_because: Josh and Chuck at How Stuff Works opened our eyes to it.
lender.occupational_info: Tom works for the United States military repairing aircraft avionic systems. His goal after his service to the military is providing homes with photovoltaic solar electrical power in his community and attending school full time in studies as an Electrical Engineer. Tom is like a mad scientist with the things he does in his garage or at work; he loves dogs, bicycles, Subarus, alternative energy source technology, and Kimmy. Kimmy is a full time student at University of North Texas where she studies biology. She has got a never ending zeal in organic chemistry. She has focused her energy and time for years in wetlands restoration but could interest herself in any area really. Kim is fluent in Spanish and loves diving, cycling, organized staples, dogs, and Tom. They have a dog named Brak (who never lets you forget his name) who is a Bloodhound/Mastiff with great jowls of flop. His interests are in the bracket industry but he declines further elaboration on that. Braks best friend is Rocket. His favorite things are walks, bike rides, Wiggly field, weenies, belly rubs, and car rides.

lender.name: Yvonne
lender.loan_because: In the mid-1980's I found myself with no income and two children to support. I wanted to work but didn't even have clothes suitable for a job interview. An acquaintance took me to a thrift store and bought me a skirted suit for $17.00. With that suit I went to job interviews and landed a modest job. It was a start. From there, I was able to steadily improve our lives. Anyone can find themselves in a desparate situation unexpectedly; and it can seem like a miracle when someone steps forward to give you a hand up. It was for me. And now, when I think back about how impossible it was to come up with a spare $17 to buy a suit; and how someone, out-of-the-blue, said, "Come on", and drove me to the thrift store and bought me that suit . . . I am just amazed at how just the right thing happened at just the right time, and I was able to use it to get back on my feet. I'm not wealthy, but I am self sufficient and living comfortably now, and so are my children. So it seems to me that giving someone a "hand up" instead of a hand out" may be the best way to help them help themselves. At the same time, this allows them to keep their dignity and build confidence and pride in their accomplishments. I want to be a part of that for somebody else - and perhaps for many somebody elses.
lender.occupational_info: I am retired from government service. Now I write short stories, paint and work around the house helping my partner with repairs and improvements.

lender.name: Sonam Norboo
lender.loan_because: I care.
lender.occupational_info: Teach in a University.

lender.name: Ville
lender.loan_because:
I think that this (Kiva) is one of the greatest examples of totally new things that humanity can accomplish with modern technology. Without the Internet this would never have been possible. Almost anyone can now become a micro-lender from the comfort of their own home. That is truly great, and I want to support both Kiva and the people who get the loans.
I have to confess that I am a bit of a science and technology optimist. I believe that modern science and technology, which develop at an accelerating rate all the time, will eventually solve most of the Earth's important problems.
Kiva is a part of solving poverty through technological means. I believe that extreme poverty can be eradicated from the world during my lifetime: this goal just requires better political decisions in addition to new ideas and inventions.
Other pressing global problems might be solved with the help of science and technology eventually, too: energy and global warming problems (fusion energy or more efficient renewable energy), human rights violations (free information sharing via the Internet and organizations like Amnesty International), HIV (cheap drugs and condoms, education) and so on.
There are some problems which science and technology have made worse, too, most notably war. Science and technology have produced nuclear, chemical and biological weapons, landmines, artillery - basically all "unfair" ways of killing another human. Not that direct physical violence like shooting or stabbing would be acceptable, of course not. I think that war is always total madness, a humanitarian catastrophe and almost always also a very big political mistake even when examined from a purely economic and "realpolitik" perspective. But still, even though all killing is bad, some methods of killing are even worse than others.
When I say "science" I don't mean it in the "hard science" sense (mathematics, physics, chemistry, computer science etc.). I also include social sciences and philosophy, which have produced maybe even greater inventions than the natural sciences. Examples: democracy, freedom, human rights, open source software, free education (at least in Finland), minority rights and so on. Of course, social sciences and philosophy have also produced absolute failures like fascism, stalinism, theocracy and other sad examples.
Still, when I compare the benefits that science and technology have brought to the mankind with the problems, I think that the positive side wins by a wide margin.
Also, the stories of the entrepreneurs in Kiva are really interesting. The few community aspects which are there are good (teams etc.) but I think they could be made a lot better.
With some new community features (implemented well) Kiva could become the Facebook of people who have some surplus money and want to use it to make the world a better place. That could even make Kiva commercially very profitable, which would be a good thing because then Kiva would be able to hire new employees to spread the word and to enhance the website. Because Kiva is a non-profit company, all the money they earn is put into employing more people or paying higher wages for the people who work there. Which they truly deserve.
You could also cover the development and operating costs by taking very small cuts of the transfers (under 1%) or by selling advertising (which is not even annoying for users if done well, like Google and Facebook). I think that anyone who would be offended either a) be an idiot, or b) hold moral principles which are very alien to mine.
Kiva should also expand its operations to other countries, including also wealthy countries like Western European countries, Canada, Australia etc. Of course, this requires actions not only from Kiva, but from local banks and entrepreneurs too. Maybe Kiva could become a kind of "fair loan" system for the whole World.
This would enable users to also donate money to good causes in wealthier countries. Sure, there is more need for the money in the developing countries, but I think that there are lots of people who might not want to donate money to developing countries but might want to help local (to them) causes. There can be many reasons for this: a burning desire to help some local group, not knowing enough about the circumstances in developing countries, simply racism etc., but the reason does not matter: what matters is that those people could also give money to good things if they were sure where it goes. Now that money goes to their own consumption: through that Kiva-like website it could go to helping others.
There are some very disadvantaged groups in wealthy countries, too, and many people, including me, would like to help them a little. That, of course, would not remove the need to help people in developing countries too. The people who want and are able to help others usually care about both: the suffering people in the third world and the suffering people in their own country.
lender.occupational_info:
I design and implement computer programs and web sites. I also do a little bit of other things in the software industry, like gather requirements, hold training courses and do some sales support.
I am also a part-time musician, so I shamelessly abuse my Kiva account by linking my lender page to the web page of Cold Cold Ground. I sincerely hope that this advertising does not offend anyone.
Cold Cold Ground is not a very commercial band, and they have never earned a single euro for their music. Of course they have sold some records etc., but the costs of their music "hobby" have this far been a lot higher than their earnings from it (buying instruments and equipment, paying the rent of practice space, hiring recording engineers and producers etc.). So I don't think that this is an example of misusing one's Kiva account for commercial interests.
I also suppose that almost no one except myself and some of my closest friends will read this lender page anyway, so nobody will probably even notice.

lender.name: anastase
lender.loan_because: I want to make a loan because i want to help the groups of women we over see in our ngo THE NEW COVENANT& AFRICAIN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT / in NOUVELLE ALLIANCE POUR LE DEVELOPPMENT DES COMMUNAUTES AFRICAINES (NADCA) in Benin Republic Mailling address : 05 BP 1196 Cotonou - Republic of Benin-West Africa. Mobile + 229 97 98 30 68 / Office Tel +229 21 07 01 83 . Our aims is : To help them to overcome poverty in our community in the republic of Benin West AFRICA. Many want to trade to help their children to be able to go to school and support the developpment of their communities but are unable because of the finances limitations. Many becauce of the poverty they give their children out for prostitution or child slavery and all this lead the young girls to a force mariage and unprepared pregnant that lead to abortion . Our aim is to fight that mentalities by providing some loan of 3500 USD for 14 young women to buy a sowing machins and goods to sale in the market and some working tools.We pray that by the end of July we can have it .This to help also preach Christ to those who are without to help them leave for christ alone. May the Lord Help us and grant us this request. Anastase Henri Ologoudou Director of the ngo
lender.occupational_info: Our work is to interceced for the nation of Benin and Africa, help the orphans, preach the gospel, and help our communities out of poverty. As we stated earlier . Deffend the right of the children and the new born as we have always do by keeping orphans from the day the mother delivered and throw to the roadside, and by the grace of God we have been taking care of them. WE NOW WANT TO HELP THE WOMEN TO BE ABLE TO WORK SALE TO BE ABLE TO HELP THE COMMUNITIES. WE CAN SEND YOU SOME PHOTOS OF OUR ACTIVITIES AND WORKS WITH THE WOMEN IF YOU REQUEST.

lender.occupational_info: I program the computers that control telephone systems

lender.name: Jeff
lender.loan_because: I am called to help others less fortunate.

lender.name: Smile Family
lender.loan_because: We want to help people less fortunate than ourselves. We particularly want to help mothers because we think it's the hardest and most important job of all.
lender.occupational_info: I create internet websites for companies.

lender.name: Stephen
lender.loan_because: I want to help other people in the world succeed as I believe in fate and if you have the will power and determination you will reach your goal.
lender.occupational_info: I work for a global organisation who sell products throughout the world.

lender.name: CREJIA Company
lender.loan_because: Helping others achieve & fulfill their goals and dreams, is our passion!
lender.occupational_info: CREJIA Company offers resources, funding, even volunteer labor, anyway we can, whenever we can. Lending through the Kiva network, allows us to use our resources to help many other entrepreneurs accomplish their goals. We succeed by helping others succeed!

lender.name: Fiber Friends
lender.loan_because: Making art is important to us and we want to help others to make their own work.
lender.occupational_info: We are a group of artists who make work for the Artomat project www.artomat.org. Proceeds from the sale of our work will go to Kiva loans -- to other artists, when possible.

lender.name: Jason
lender.loan_because: I think, that when given an opportunity, all people can better their lives. Everyone deserves a chance. Who wouldn't want to be a part of that?

lender.name: Greg Mariotti
lender.loan_because: I like to help...

lender.name: Mark
lender.loan_because: Everyone needs to give something back for the “good” we receive in our lives. I have had many people in my life see that they were “good” to me. I hope I can do more “good” than I ever received.

lender.name: JAN-ARIS OLIVER
lender.occupation: Incoming College Student with a Part-Time job

lender.name: Huong
lender.loan_because: I'm trying to pay it forward.

lender.name: Jenna
lender.loan_because: It feels so good & does such great things
lender.occupational_info: My work is to help people.

lender.name: corinne
lender.loan_because: I like to help
lender.occupational_info: Former database architect, .Net developer and web designer.

lender.name: Adrian
lender.loan_because:
Too Help other people, some are luckier than others. 10% of income goes into helping others, it's important to make are better world for everyone. As we help other GOD will help us when we are suddenly in need.
All our investments are reinvested to help others.
lender.occupational_info: Private Montessori School

lender.name: Greg
lender.loan_because: I want to give hardworking people a chance to better their lives.
lender.occupational_info: My work is building awareness and attracting interest from customers for the products that I market

lender.name: Laura
lender.loan_because: I can and because it works!!!

lender.name: dommaraju
lender.loan_because: I would like to be of help to budding entrepreneurs
lender.occupational_info: At present building up wine legend India pvt ltd as a significant player in evolving wine business in India. Also has ERP Foundation to help rural development.

lender.name: kamarou
lender.loan_because: i like it
lender.occupational_info: very cool

lender.name: Adrian
lender.loan_because: I LIke to seea life transformed and the needs of a family met ! to see Progress and that I can make a small difference in a persons or familys life !
lender.occupational_info: I am a supervisor in an Oil co,

lender.name: Alex
lender.loan_because: it´s our business.

lender.name: Arnie
lender.loan_because: Vertical Measures is a strategic Internet marketing company, offering link building services, SEO, content marketing, social media engagement, and search engine marketing for businesses of varying sizes.

lender.name: Elena
lender.loan_because: I have no other superhero powers.

lender.name: Fredrik Lange
lender.loan_because: I loan because I want to support entrepreneurs in developing countries.

lender.name: Alan Alborn
lender.loan_because: I recognize that the "Free Market" becomes "complicated" as businesses scale and become de facto Governments that decide who gets a job where and, we may buy or sell, and influence Policy... And I don't have an answer. Like everything else in our environment... It's evolving... we don't understand the end state yet. That being said, I firmly believe that free market capitalism is the path out of poverty for the poor in the third world. I target women owned businesses because women's rights often don't exist in primitive cultures (they are viewed as property and abused beyond belief) and economic power IS power in these places. Come on... You can afford a few bucks to help someone you don't know. Make a Kiva loan (and share this post).
lender.occupational_info: I am a Libertarian Philosopher. I devote my time to promoting Free Markets and Libertarian thinking wherever I can.

lender.name: Jelena
lender.occupation: mother of four, advanced university student
lender.loan_because: I have to finish studies, to get a regular job. My children are small, so all the help is welcomed, we live in one room apartment, and we dream of building a house, but first thing is first. Thank all of you who understand and help us.
lender.occupational_info: At the moment I am with 4th baby, so I get some kind of social help, because I haven't finish master studies, and I don't have a regular job.

lender.name: Fampieters
lender.loan_because: We believe Microfinance is a more direct contribution, a "business deal" and makes more sense than aid (ref. "Dead Aid" by Dambisa Moyo).
lender.occupational_info: Independent (Investment Fund) Director

lender.name: samuel
lender.loan_because: i want to grow my business and then pay back the initial capital with interest.
lender.occupational_info: well' i will say it is a way of circulating MTN'S product and also to make my profit.

lender.name: Natasha
lender.occupational_info: I am an observational astronomer, which means that I take pictures of stars and galaxies in the sky, using big and small telescopes located around the world, and then I try to figure out what the pictures mean.

lender.name: Uwe
lender.loan_because: Think we all could share the wealth of our northern hemisphere with those not having as many opportunities as we are facing everyday. Just lending a small amount of money is only a little piece in the whole puzzle but I'd like to enable people somewhere else to gain better living and housing conditions.
lender.occupational_info: I am in IT business. As I am project leader of national and international projects I come around a lot and have experienced lots of cultural and conditional differences throughout Europe, Asia and America.

lender.name: Swapan
lender.loan_because: I know first hand how much difference access to small amounts of capital can make.
lender.occupational_info: Simulate reality on computers to design better products and processes.

lender.name: Maddie
lender.occupation: Student at a very prestigious (ha!) middle school
lender.loan_because: I want people to be able to get by and earn a living. Everyone should be happy.
lender.occupational_info: Learning boring information that I won't use later in life but I have to learn anyway.

lender.name: Madeleine
lender.loan_because: I know that from small business efforts, many lives can be enriched.
lender.occupational_info: I promote and organise local community ventures which build community and bring people together to be constructive, active and effective.

lender.name: Mateo
lender.loan_because: i own a PTC website and its really hard to get started, i promise i will never forget if i get this loan, i will give to others when i have money wich i currently dont, my family is in a bad money situation too, they have tons of debts
lender.occupational_info: i run a website, i payout people and i deal with the support tickets

lender.name: Adrienne & Kellen
lender.loan_because: We have been blessed and we want to help others
lender.occupational_info: Mom, wife, daughter, friend

lender.name: Jerrica
lender.loan_because: I want to help others.

lender.name: Linda
lender.loan_because: It makes me feel good to know that I can impact someone else's life in a positive way. I grew up with a 'mission action' mind set from church. This is no different, except for the distance.

lender.name: Heather
lender.loan_because: Others in life have helped me, I believe it passing that on.

lender.name: Jennifer
lender.loan_because: I want to help others succeed.
lender.occupational_info: I am a personal assistant and help my boss run her business from her home. I spend a lot of time on the computer and running errands for her.
